   How Laughter Works 
 Human beings love to laugh: the average adult laughs 17
times a day. For us it seems so natural, but the funny thing is that humans are
one of the few species that laugh. Laughter is actually a complex response
that involves many of the same skills used in solving problems. In this
article, learn how laughter works and why laughter can make people healthier
and happier.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 How Espresso Works - It's a great pick-me-up in the morning and a perfect finish
to a good meal. Ever think about trying to make this stuff at home? Find out
what espresso actually is and how to make a perfect shot every time.
 
How Gossip Works - More than 200 years ago, Catherine the Great's enemies
invented a bit of gossip about her that has persisted until today. Learn how
gossip gets passed off as fact, about the different types of gossip and why
gossip is so ubiquitous.
 
How Karate Works - Karate is an incredible art form, built on the concept of
merging body and mind into a defensive weapon. See how practitioners of karate
use this technique to break wood and cinder blocks with their hands and feet.
   
This Week's Video 
How Skydiving Works - Imagine falling out of an airplane -- on purpose
-- and heading toward the ground at 120 miles per hour. Welcome to the world of
skydiving. In this video, watch as HowStuffWorks' founder, Marshall Brain, explores
the incredible thrill of skydiving.
